thread.title: ‘Just a few days old’: Orca calf spotted in Puget Sound | Globalnews.ca
thread.title_full: ‘Just a few days old’: Orca calf spotted in Puget Sound | Globalnews.ca

author: Darrian Matassa-Fung Global News
title: ‘Just a few days old’: Orca calf spotted in Puget Sound | Globalnews.ca
text:
An endangered orca pod in the Pacific Northwest region appears to have a new family member.
On Boxing Day, the Centre for Whale Research said photos were taken of a brand new orca calf , who was swimming with “J pod.”
It is the first time the calf has been spotted, leading the centre to believe the calf is “just a few days old.”
The calf was observed near adult female orca J40, which researchers believe is the likely mother.
0:55 Toxic chemicals found in orcas around B.C. “We hope to see lots more of this calf in the coming weeks and months, and that both the calf and its mother will be able to thrive,” centre staff said.
Trending Now Last Canadian missing after Hamas attack confirmed dead, family says Gypsy Rose Blanchard released from prison 8 years after mother’s murder Story continues below advertisement The sex of the calf is unclear at this time, according to the centre.
Get the latest National news. Sent to your email, every day. The southern resident killer whale population is believed to be hovering around 74 for the region.
1:07 Pod of orcas put on stunning show in BC harbour
